comments.body: What is field.value containing? btw you have to write ! into if statement. Like this if(!regx.test(field.value))

developer tools console would have an error message, something like SyntaxError: missing ( before condition - if you develop, get to know and love the developer tools, available in all good browsers as a standard feature, usually invoked by using the F12 key
move the ! inside the if statement
OP needs does not match in the if block, not else block.

answers.body:
Sounds like you need an else statement:

if (!regx.test(field.value)) {
   console.log('does not match');
} else {
   console.log('it matches!');
}

title: JavaScript regex field value
body:
Hi I'm trying to see if a value does not equal something with this code

if !(regx.test(field.value))

I know that if (regx.test(field.value)) this works fine, I would just like it to do something if it does not match.
